text: DØE. Hazy grey without head. Aroma is sweet, cooked rice and anise. Flavor is quite. Sweet finish with warming alcohol. 190517

Appearance is a slightly hazy pale yellow. Aroma is a bit of solvent some citrus rice and not entirely Pleasant. Maybe its an acquired appreciation. Flavor is similar to nose with a long finish. Body isnt bad.

Looks almost like water. Medium-bodied with sparkling carbonation. Boozy aroma with notes of vinegar. Spicy flavour with notes of vinegar, and a sweet taste with no bitterness. Warming alcohol. Overall, a rather odd sensation. This is the first sake I have ever tried. Maybe it goes well with sushi.

Bottle at Winking Lizard. Pours a slightly milky colorless/white with a minimal head and sparse legs on the glass. Aroma of rice, fruit and spice. Full-bodied and boozy with flavors of rice, citrus and mild spice. The finish is fruity with a citrus and alcohol aftertaste. Pretty average overall.

330 ml bottle. Unclear oily, yellow body without any head. Aroma is relatively fruity with marzipan, rice and a hint of anise. Flavor is sweet, fruity, hint of anise and quite smooth. Strong body and medium aftertaste. Quite OK, but feels a bit boozy.
Bottle. Clear-yellow colour with no head. Flavour is alcohol, sourness, rice, citrus. Ordinary sake.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear. Im not really a big fan of sake. Maybe a touch of anise? Rice wine.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours cloudy golden, aniseed, pineapple nose, dry earthy taste, sweet.
bottle at home ... light yellow ... soft fruits ... light pineapple nose ... soft alcohol ... soft rice ... dry earthy tones ...
Bottle, courtesy of yngwie. Pours hazy and still . Aroma of rice, alcohol, some fruitiness and marzipan. Flavor is sweet and warming with some rice and licorice. Medium body.

Bottle, 30cl. A hazy, lightly colored sake, oily and flat. The aroma is a bit rough in the start, but it mellows. Canned pears, some citrus hints and a little hint if anise in the aroma. Alcohol and some rice too. Its lightly oily on the palate, quite dry too. Pears, rice, some alcohol and a touch of citrus peel. Long warming finish. A tasteful one, although a bit rough initially. 140502

Bottle 300ml @ Hostel room, Ankel Hostel, Oslo
Pours slightly hazy clear milky white without a head. Aroma has notes of rice, alcohol, citrus and hint of anise. Taste is light to medium sweet with a long warm, fruity, anise finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, no carbonation

Pours a blank colour. Aroma of pear and grass. Very heavy and good smell! Flavour is a bit too short imo, with pear, citrus and floral notes. A tiny alcohol stinch in the end. Good body with a quite smiith palate. A okey sake, but not the best Ive tried.

Appearance: Hazy white color with no head.Aroma: Yeast, rice, and mild fruity.Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a mild bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Yeast, alcohol, rice and light fruity.Overall impression: A nice girl tried to learn me something about sake. And I think she was clever. For the first time I liked it. It had a very fresh and fizzy texure. This one should be the first pressed sake from the tank. And yeast still left in the bottle.Personal stats: Bottle at Beer13 in Oslo, Norway
Sample @ SBWF 12. Clear colour. Fruity rice aroma. Sweet fruit, rice alcohol flavour.

Sweet fruits, some earth, wood, spices and mild alcohol in the aroma. Flavour is the same, but has a dominating grapefruity sweetish tone to it, which wasnt in the aroma. Pleasant and very refreshing.

Smells a bit like vomit and cottage cheese. Hazy yellow. Rough edges, very hot. Cantaloupe flavor, but lots of alcohol. Finishes nice with plantains of all things! Im still learning sake, but this I didnt enjoy.

Bottled.An unclear water colored sake. The aroma is sweet with notes of rice and alcohol as well as light notes of citrus. The flavor is sweet with notes of rice, but also with a bit of acidity, and alcohol that leaves a burn in the throat. Thanks Storm for sharing.

Bottle courtesy of solan.  Pours a milky clear with some floaters.  Nose is sweet rice, light citrus and mild wood.  Taste is more sweet rice, plums, orange peel and a touch of alcohol in the finish.  Medium mouth feel.  Decent stuff, thanks Alan!

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2014 Bottle 180ml. [ As Kikusakari Kurashizuku ].Light light unclear crystal - light light yellow color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, fruity, light alcohol. Flavour is moderate sweet to light heavy with a long duration, sweet fruity, flowers, rice. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20140316]  7-2-7-3-15 
Bottle 720ml. [ As Kikusakari Kurashizuku Junmai Ginjo Nigori Sake ].Clear white color with virtually none head. Aroma is light alcohol. Flavor is moderate sweet and alcohol with a long duration. It taste like ouzo. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20080613]   7-1-6-3-13

(Bottle 72 cl) Courtesy of Storm. Pours a hazy, greyish golden with no head. Soft, sweetish rice aroma. Medium body with a soft mouthfeel, notes of aniseed and fruit. Pleasant and very drinkable. 190408

This looks like any other glass of water in the pour, very cool and clean, with a hint of licorice and alcohol in the nose.  The alcohol really takes a lot of heat on the top of the palate in this one.  Its very light and delicate and somewhat sweet with some great acidity.  I would love to enjoy this with food.
Hazy watery color with no head. Sweet fruity aroma with honey notes. Sweet flavor with fruity and alchohol notes. Ends with warming alcohol.
Bottle. A watercoloured sake with no head. It taste much like ouzo, licorice and alcohol. Medium o full body with a alcoholic finish.

72 cl. Bottle [Thanks to Storm] this was my first sake, and what a great experience. Quit different than anything else that I have tried. Very watery pale yellow looking, but with somewhat of a glow. Aroma was quite difficult to describe, but what I picked up was menthol, liquorish, vegetable. Over the palate came alcohol, vegetable, strange floral feel, some flower. Full bodied with an alcoholic texture. 
Alcoholic flower like finish. My first Sake was a very interesting experience. Would have liked it with Sushi. 
7-3-7-3-14
19-04-2008

72 cL bottle, thanks to Storm - my first sake ever! Pours hazy and pale yellow with no head. Light spiced and mild alcohol aroma. Liqourice and mint aroma. Flavour is liqourice and menthol. Dry and light spiced finish. Reminds me a lot about the greek ouzo drink.

Hazed yellowish milky liquid. No sparkle, so m a bit leery. Strong sweet rice aromas with just a touch of birch sap in the background. LIght vanilla and white jelly bean flavors. A touch of burn in the finish but otherwise the alcohol is quite minimal. Quite smooth and a relaxing type sake. I would enjoy this after a nice dinner.

This bottled sake from a bottle shop poured a extremely small sized head of medium sized clear colored bubbles that were quickly diminishing and left behind a hazy very softly carbonated light clear  hazy with some floating particulate white colored body and no lacing. The mild aroma was vinous with rice and mild woody esters. The mildly vinous mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and strongly tingly at the finish with a strong vinous alcohol aftertaste. The strong flavor contained notes of alcohol and ricel. A decent one that I would consider buying again.  My bottle also read 15% ABV.

This one looks very unique, which really begs one to consume it.  The still body is a lightly hazy grayish tint, with tons of very fine floating particulate suspended throughout the liquid.  Fairly thick legs coat the glass well on a swirl, indicating a substantial body.  Like the appearance, the aroma is fairly unique.  Notes of koji, rice pudding, and freshly sliced plums meet a solitary drop of lemon, combining to make a very inviting scent profile.  The flavor is simultaneously sweet, sharp and tangy.  Koji dominates, but fruity notes and a lemony creaminess play major roles as well.  As the look hints, the body is on the fuller side, with a unique tingle showing some carbonation that I didnt expect.  Very solid, unique Nigori.

180 ml bottle reads 15% abv.  Clean yeasty sake aroma.  Pours almost clear with little chunks.  Wow, intense flavor, tingles the tongue with a hint at carbonation.  Sweet and tangy, sharp right off the bat.  The aftertaste has some anise notes.  Amazing.  Very delightful!

Milky light white color, light sparkling qualities. I expect something different when the cap releases pressure when you open it. The nose has some earthy koji and light tropical fruits, not much in the realm of umami or alcohol, slightly medicinal as well. The flavor is a real turn off, very tart with more a slap of koji on the tounge. The tail is brief but not very good. Overall the alcohol is very well hidden but the flavor just doesnt qualify this as an easy drinking beverage. Thanks to IdahoJizake for letting me try this.

First (and last) sparkling sake I will ever try. Surprisingly clean pour for a nigori, moderately cloudy/chunky. Very citrusy aroma; can sense the carbonation. Pleasing smell but thats where any good points of this sake end. Very strong citrus flavor; carbonation is far too overpowering to assess much more on the taste. Alcohol is not evident until the less than desireable aftertaste finally fades away. Dont waste your money on this unless you like sparkling sake; just dissolve some aspirin in lemon-lime gatorade to get the same effect.
